ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was fun to see what other art majors are up to for their theses, and receive feedback on my own project.
I got feedback on my senior project and professional guests shared helpful tips about navigating the postgraduate art world.
This course was more centralized on how to develop a professional art persona (incredibly helpful info that never is discussed in other classes)

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: I felt like the format really worked in spite of the pandemic's restrictions. It really feels like Prof. Kereszi and the teaching staff (and even the class' guests) are doing their best to make the class interesting and engaging to us. 
Weaknesses: The class sometimes feels kind of disjointed because of the nature of concentrations within the major.

Strengths:  Lisa is an empathetic and accessible professor. The guest speakers were interesting and offered a lot of advice. Weaknesses: Since the class was made up of people from different concentrations, not everything applied to my field of interest. I also really wish I was assigned an advisor earlier because I feel like I got too far into my project without any focused guidance. Ways to improve: Assign advisors at the beginning of the semester so they can help students with the critical first few steps of their projects (i.e. ideation, research, initial directions, etc.).

Strengths: small class size left room for plenty of conversation 

Weaknesses: not all speakers were necessarily in the same field as you were

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I really liked how open Prof. Kereszi was to using the chat in class. I feel like it encouraged contributions from people who otherwise wouldn't speak up as much.
Since all of our guest speakers were virtual, we got to hear from people who might not otherwise have been able to visit Yale in person.
I think we did the best job we could in this class to be entirely honest! I actually enjoy the seminar setting

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. There is definitely a lot of sitting around during critiques, especially when its outside your concentration and when there are guest critics present, but this class was a lot better than previous reviews had led me to expect. Lisa is a super caring professor/DUS. The guest speakers shower you with information and advice. And its cool to see how other art majors have grown during their time at Yale and what theyre doing for their senior projects.
Its a requirement but I definitely think its a great class to think through professional goals you mightve looked over beforehand
